derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the general sense 'worthy, appropriate'): from Old French condigne, from Latin condignus, from con- 'altogether' + dignus 'worthy'

means.word_mean: 1. fitting or appropriate and deserved; used especially of punishment;
